qas.question: At what pub did Ronnie Kray kill someone in 1966?
What pub is associated with some of Jack the Ripper's victims?
Outside what pub was David Blakely shot?
What is the present name of the former Crown and Anchor?
In what year did Joseph Stalin visit London?

context: In 1966 <a0_0>The Blind Beggar<a0_0/> in Whitechapel became infamous as the scene of a murder committed by gangster Ronnie Kray. <a1_0>The Ten Bells<a1_0/> is associated with several of the victims of Jack the Ripper. In 1955, Ruth Ellis, the last woman executed in the United Kingdom, shot David Blakely as he emerged from <a2_0>The Magdala<a2_0/> in South Hill Park, Hampstead, the bullet holes can still be seen in the walls outside. It is said that Vladimir Lenin and a young Joseph Stalin met in the Crown and Anchor pub (now known as <a3_0>The Crown Tavern<a3_0/>) on Clerkenwell Green when the latter was visiting London in <a4_0>1903<a4_0/>.
